name: HCLAppScanOnCloud
description: Perform static, dynamic, mobile and open source security tests for your applications in AppScan on Cloud.
author: HCLTechnologies
instanceNameFormat: Run HCL AppScan on Cloud Security Test

inputs.name: AppSecTestService
inputs.label: Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the credentials to use for running a scan. Add credentials using the HCL AppScan on Cloud Service. How do I get my credentials?

inputs.name: applications
inputs.label: Application
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application that this scan will be associated with. If the list is empty ensure that you have a valid selection in the Credentials field.

inputs.name: scanname
inputs.label: Scan Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: An optional name for the scan. This name is used to differentiate results on the Build page.

inputs.name: scantype
inputs.label: Scan Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The type of test to run.

inputs.name: scanloc
inputs.label: Repository Subdirectory To Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Limits the scan to a subdirectory of the repository. Leave this field blank to scan the entire repository.

inputs.name: dynamicType
inputs.label: Dynamic Scan Type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Dynamic (DAST) -- Scan Web applications or web services.

Dynamic (upload file) -- Scan from AppScan Standard file

inputs.name: scanURL
inputs.label: Starting URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL where the scan will start exploring the site.

inputs.name: scanfile
inputs.label: Scan File

validation.message: Choose a valid .scan or .scant or .config file.

inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to a scan template file (.scan or .scant or .config)

inputs.name: appFile
inputs.label: Application File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The .apk or .ipa file to be scanned.

inputs.name: OpenSourceScanOnly
inputs.label: Open Source Only
inputs.helpMarkDown: To run static analysis with the open source only option, the user must have open source only enabled in the cloud subscription.

inputs.name: ScanSpeedOptions
inputs.label: Select Scan Speed

options.simple: Simple - A simple scan performs a surface-level analysis of your files to identify the most pressing issues for remediation. It takes the least amount of time to complete.
options.balanced: Balanced - A balanced scan provides a medium level of detail on the analysis and identification of security issues, and takes a bit more time to complete than the 'Simple' scan.
options.deep: Deep - A deep scan performs a more complete analysis of your files to identify vulnerabilities, and usually takes longer to complete
options.thorough: Thorough - A thorough scan performs a comprehensive analysis to identify the most comprehensive list of vulnerabilities and will take the longest time to complete.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Options to determine the scan speed

inputs.name: type
inputs.label: Environment

options.production: Live Production Site  -  During the Scan we will not automatically fill out forms or execute JavaScript code. The scan is less likely to affect the site or the structure of the scan but might take longer.
options.staging: Staging or Testing Environment  -  During the scan we will fill out forms automatically and execute JavaScript code to try and discover as much content as possible. This is a much more comprehensive scan, but also more likely to affect the structure and stability of the site.

inputs.helpMarkDown:
Environment

Selecting an environment will affect the Explore stage of the scan

validation.message: Select either Live Production Site or Staging or Testing Environment.

inputs.name: loginMethod
inputs.label: Application Login
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Application Login

Provide login credentials so AppScan can scan pages that require authentication.

You can either type username and password manually, or record the login process using AppScan Activity Recorder (browser extension for Chrome and Edge).

Note:The login credentials are stored safely, but we recommend that you use a dedicated test account.

[Learn more](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/asd_scanning_CM.html)

inputs.name: dynamicuser
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Username

Provide a valid username for HCL AppScan on Cloud to use to log in when scanning your app.

inputs.name: dynamicloginpassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password

Enter the password for the provided username. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: dynamicextra
inputs.label: Third Credential
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Third Credential

If your application login process requires a third credential, add it here.

inputs.name: logintrafficFile
inputs.label: Login Sequence File
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Login Sequence File

Provide a path to the Login Traffic File data. Supported file type: CONFIG: AppScan Activity Recorder file.

How to record login?

To use the AppScan Activity Recorder extension (for Chrome or Edge):

  1. Install [AppScan Activity Recorder](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/appscan-activity-recorder/ijbfdoojnepibegmkhhilmeijonibmcn?hl=en%E2%80%8B).
  2. Open a new tab, enter the Starting URL.
  3. Click the extension icon, and record your login sequence.
    Note: You must be logged out of the application before you start the recording.
  4. When finished, click the extension icon again, to stop the recording. You will be prompted to save the CONFIG file.
  5. Select the file here.
[Learn more](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/r_record_traffic.html)

inputs.name: network
inputs.label: Network
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Network

If your server is located in a private network, and not accessible to the internet, AppScan needs a Presence to gain access to the server.To set up, go to AppScan Presence

[Learn more](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/appseccloud_scanning_presence.html)

inputs.name: dynamicpresence
inputs.label: Presence
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Presence

An [AppScan Presence](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/appseccloud_scanning_presence.html) on your server enables you to scan sites not accessible from the Internet, and to incorporate scanning as part of your functional testing.

inputs.name: optimization
inputs.label: Test Optimization
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Test Optimization

You can reduce scan time by choosing a balance between speed and issue coverage. Optimized scans omit tests defined in the Test policy for less severe or less likely vulnerabilities, based on ongoing statistical analyses. Note: The actual reduction in time, and extent of issue coverage, will vary depending on your application.

[Learn more](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/dast_test_optimization.html)

Personal scan

A personal scan does not affect the application data and compliance until it is promoted. If not promoted it is deleted after 30 days.

[Learn more](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/appseccloud_scans_personal.html)
